list_definition.definition: (usually with aboutor around) to make scratching noises or movements

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was scrabbling about looking for the money he had dropped.

list_ex_of_english: It has been known for weeks that there was a threat of floods in the area, so there is something wrong if we are scrabbling around for helicopters.
She will have to scrabble round her house.
We are scrabbling around among the poor to make that distinction.
They spent most of the time discussing the problems of having to scrabble, for funds from various sources.
Desperate people are scrabbling for food.
I know that there will be a scrabble for resources and that there will be in-fighting to try to win resources.
The press are given press releases to read, while we have to scrabble around and to listen carefully to what is said.
One scrabbles about and finds a pair of spectacles that makes one see rather better.
